perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Effective Date' to 'Start Date,' 'Reseller' to 'Distributor,' and 'Company' to 'Corporation' in the preamble, while the definitions section still refers to the original terms. This creates confusion regarding which definitions and obligations apply to each party and the agreement's commencement.

perturbation.original_text: 13.	Indemnification. Company shall indemnify, defend and hold Reseller and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, suffered or incurred by Reseller or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Company Products infringe any U.S. patent or copyright or that the Company Products incorporate any misappropriated trade secrets or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Company Products. Additionally, Reseller shall indemnify, defend and hold Company and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, suffered or incurred by Company or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Reseller’s Activities infringe any U.S. Business law or that the Reseller’s Activities violate any U.S. government process, procedure or requirement or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Reseller’s Activities.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.	Indemnification. Corporation may indemnify, defend and hold Distributor and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, suffered or incurred by Distributor or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Corporation Products infringe any U.S. patent or copyright or that the Corporation Products incorporate any misappropriated trade secrets or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Corporation Products. Additionally, Distributor must indemnify, defend and hold Corporation and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, suffered or incurred by Corporation or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Distributor’s Activities infringe any U.S. Business law or that the Distributor’s Activities violate any U.S. government process, procedure or requirement or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Distributor’s Activities.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the language from “shall indemnify” to “may indemnify” for the corporation's obligation while keeping the 'Distributor's' obligation as “must indemnify”. This creates an imbalance in the indemnification responsibilities, making the corporation's obligation discretionary, which can lead to disputes over liability.
